snippet: Philadelphia, a Stanley Cup favorite after defeating Pittsburgh, was bounced out in five games after David Clarkson scored a fitting go-ahead goal for the aggressive, opportunistic Devils.
abstract: New Jersey Devils defeat Philadelphia Flyers, 3-1, to win their Eastern Conference semifinal series, 4-1. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA -- Two lines formed on the ice for handshakes at 10:06 p.m. Tuesday, and the Devils and the Philadelphia Flyers wished each other well. A five-game series seemed like a smart prediction before it began -- but there had been a stunning twist. The Devils won. David Clarkson, the pugnacious forward, scored a fitting go-ahead goal in a 3-1 victory for the aggressive, opportunistic Devils by crashing the goal to deflect a clearing pass from Flyers goaltender Ilya Bryzgalov with his stick. The puck bounced past Bryzgalov into the net.

headline.main: Devils Crash Net, Oust Flyers And Move Halfway to a Cup
